intro: Odontites lapiei, commonly known as the Lapland toothplant, is a small, herbaceous plant native to alpine and arctic regions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic compounds. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, thriving in cold climates. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. Odontites lapiei is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in tundra and mountainous areas across Europe and Asia.
